body:
Use this service to:

* request personal information about you that is held on the Ministry of Justice's records in HM Prison and Probation services.
* this is also  known as a 'subject access request'

Submitting a request takes around 5 minutes.

So we can give you the best service, you should be as clear as you can about the information you need.

components.html: We aim to respond to all requests within one calendar month

### Before you start 

So we can answer your subject access request you must send us two things:

1. A description of where your personal data may be held. 
Please ensure that you provide details of where in the department your personal data may be held to help us to trace your records. For example, details of which court or prison you may have had dealings with, including any relevant case reference numbers and dates. Please be as specific as possible.

2. Valid identification.

Acceptable forms of ID include:

* a photocopy of your passport or driving license
* an electricity bill (a copy of the original bill)
* a gas bill (a copy of the original bill)
* a council tax bill (a copy of the original bill)
* any other bill in your full name (a copy of the original bill)

Any bill you send must be less than 6 months old.

We may charge you a fee to process your SAR if it is excessive.

extraComponents.html:
You can also request via email.

The online service is also available in Welsh (Cymraeg).

You cannot use this service if you’re in the UK illegally.
